intro: Eriogonum lachnostegium, commonly known as the Sierra foothill buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces distinctive, spiny bracts around its flower clusters. Eriogonum lachnostegium is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
